title: HomeGoods Is Selling “So Cute” Retro Cocktail Glasses That Look 10x the Price
description: “Omg perfection,” one shopper wrote. READ MORE...
author: Ashia Aubourg
text: GroceriesNewsAshia AubourgFrom the moment I started remixing ramen noodles into gourmet meals and spending hours watching cooking shows as a puny six-year-old, I knew I found a deep passion for food. While I realized — after taking on a two-year high school internship in an award-winning kitchen — that a…read morepublished nowWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Eric Glenn/ShutterstockYou can always rely on HomeGoods to drop the most precious kitchen gems — from gorgeous marble platters to darling floral espresso sets. The department store tends to blend vintage-inspired designs with modern styles in its collections. If you’re looking for timeless and elegant drinkware, you’ll want to take a trip to the retailer ASAP because these just rolled out the most beautiful glassware. People on social media cannot stop buzzing about a set of drinkware that looks like it’s right out of the ’70s. The cups boast a coupe design with frosted pink glass and a whimsical, squiggly cherry-red stem. On Etsy, you’ll spot a range of sellers offering frosted vintage drinkware from the ’70s, when this groovy style was in its prime.One person commented on the TikTok clip sharing this find, saying, “Listen, my cabinet is filled. I can’t have another cup — but how can I resist.” Another user commented, “Omg perfection.”For now, the groovy pink and red coupe glasses are only available at HomeGoods stores, while the TikTok creator doesn’t share the price, they typically can range anywhere between $4 and $7 each. While we hope you can snag these coupe glasses at HomeGoods, try Amazon if you have a hard time. For $39.99, you can buy a set of two squiggly stem cups in a frosted pink shade. One shopper left a five-star review saying this glassware is “so cute and unique!”If you’re hosting a Valentine’s or Galentine’s Day celebration, these coupe glasses will be the star of your spread. For the best deal, though, head to HomeGoods to stock up on them. Once you have them, you can fill them with a refreshing, nonalcoholic sangria or a bold pomegranate martini.
html:
• Groceries
  • News

Ashia Aubourg

From the moment I started remixing ramen noodles into gourmet meals and spending hours watching cooking shows as a puny six-year-old, I knew I found a deep passion for food. While I realized — after taking on a two-year high school internship in an award-winning kitchen — that a…read more

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

You can always rely on HomeGoods to drop the most precious kitchen gems — from gorgeous marble platters to darling floral espresso sets. The department store tends to blend vintage-inspired designs with modern styles in its collections. If you’re looking for timeless and elegant drinkware, you’ll want to take a trip to the retailer ASAP because these just rolled out the most beautiful glassware. 

People on social media cannot stop buzzing about a set of drinkware that looks like it’s right out of the ’70s. 

The cups boast a coupe design with frosted pink glass and a whimsical, squiggly cherry-red stem. On Etsy, you’ll spot a range of sellers offering frosted vintage drinkware from the ’70s, when this groovy style was in its prime.

One person commented on the TikTok clip sharing this find, saying, “Listen, my cabinet is filled. I can’t have another cup — but how can I resist.” Another user commented, “Omg perfection.”

For now, the groovy pink and red coupe glasses are only available at HomeGoods stores, while the TikTok creator doesn’t share the price, they typically can range anywhere between $4 and $7 each. 

While we hope you can snag these coupe glasses at HomeGoods, try Amazon if you have a hard time. For $39.99, you can buy a set of two squiggly stem cups in a frosted pink shade. One shopper left a five-star review saying this glassware is “so cute and unique!”

If you’re hosting a Valentine’s or Galentine’s Day celebration, these coupe glasses will be the star of your spread. For the best deal, though, head to HomeGoods to stock up on them. Once you have them, you can fill them with a refreshing, nonalcoholic sangria or a bold pomegranate martini.
